Allen Charge.definition: a charge to a deadlocked jury to make a further effort to reach a verdict esp. by each juror considering the others' opinions with deference called also dynamite charge
Allen Charge.origin: [from the Supreme Court case Allen v. United States , 164 U.S. 492 (1896), which upheld the right of a trial judge to make such a charge]
